item.title: readme
item.description: :brain: Pubky Knowledge Base Welcome to the Pubky Knowledge base - we are excited to have you here. üîó Access the Pubky Knowledge Base: notes.pubky,app! The current Knowledge base is a mix of reality, dreams, visions, actuality and plans.

item.title: vision
item.description: The Vision of Pubky: Decentralizing Our Future Imagine a future where our online relationships are no longer dictated by corporate giants or state-controlled systems, where you ...

item.title: index
item.description: Welcome to the Pubky Knowledge Base This is a knowledge base for the Pubky platform, which includes Pubky Core, PKARR and Pubky App. These documents are a work in progress, much like Pubky‚Äôs protocols and applications! What is Pubky? Pubky attempts to unlock the web by realizing our vision for a key-based, self-regulating web that puts users in control.

item.title: Perspectives
item.description: Perspectives Users can save any custom-filtered view or feed as a ‚Äúperspective‚Äù which is basically a custom template of settings of tags, weights, users, reach, and trends ...

item.title: Posts
item.description: Posts In Pubkey client, a post is a message that a user publishes on the platform. Posts are the core content and they can contain a variety of information, including: Text: There is not text limitation of plain text, which can include words, phrases, sentences, or even just a single character.

item.title: Profiles
item.description: Profiles In Pubky client, a profile refers to a user‚Äôs personal page on the app, which displays their information, posts, and other content. A Pubky profile is a unique identity that represents a public-key.

item.title: Search
item.description: Search While Tags & Filters are the primary sorting tools, the app also provides limited traditional search capabilities.

item.title: Tags
item.description: Tags They are keywords or phrases that are added to a tweet to help users find and engage with the content. Users can publicly assign contextual tags, like hashtags, to any other user or post.

item.title: Trends
item.description: Trends Pubky client can provide statistical views of the data it has access to and then establish visualizations and leaderboard lists of trending posts, tags, and users. ...

item.title: Introduction
item.description: Pubky Client The Pubky client will be available as both a desktop application and a hosted website service (standard website) that allows users to interface with the social media ...
